description: This is a modern 'Global View' dashboard for your Kubernetes cluster(s). Made for kube-prometheus-stack and take advantage of the latest Grafana features. GitHub repository: https://github.com/dotdc/grafana-dashboards-kubernetes

panels.description:
Total CPU utilization in Percentages.
**Current Usage** – CPU currently in use.
**Requests** – Total CPU requested by all apps.
**Limits** – Total CPU limit set for all apps.
panels.title: Total CPU Usage

panels.description:
Total Memory utilization in Percentages.
**Current Usage** – Memory currently in use.
**Requests** – Total Memory requested by all apps.
**Limits** – Total Memory limit set for all apps.
panels.title: Total Memory Usage

panels.description:
Total CPU utilization in Cores.
**Current Usage** – CPU currently in use.
**Requests** – Total CPU requested by all apps.
**Limits** – Total CPU limit set for all apps.
panels.title: Total CPU Usage

panels.description:
Total Memory utilization in bytes.
**Current Usage** – Memory currently in use.
**Requests** – Total Memory requested by all apps.
**Limits** – Total Memory limit set for all apps.
panels.title: Total Memory Usage

panels.description: Total currently running pods in Cluster
panels.title: Running Pods

panels.description: Current cluster CPU usage in percentage over time
panels.title: Cluster CPU Utilization

panels.description: Current cluster Memory usage in percentage over time
panels.title: Cluster Memory Utilization

panels.description: Current cluster CPU usage (%) over time across all namespaces,  with a table displaying minimum, maximum, and average usage and a time-based graph for trends

targets.expr:
sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{image!="", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval])) by (namespace)
+ on (namespace)
(sum(rate(windows_container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{container_id!="", cluster="$cluster"}[$__rate_interval]) * on (container_id) group_left (container, pod, namespace) max by ( container, container_id, pod, namespace) (kube_pod_container_info{container_id!="", cluster="$cluster"}) OR kube_namespace_created{cluster="$cluster"} * 0) by (namespace))

panels.title: CPU Utilization by namespace

panels.description: Current cluster Memory usage (%) over time across all namespaces,  with a table displaying minimum, maximum, and average usage and a time-based graph for trends

targets.expr:
sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{image!="", cluster="$cluster"}) by (namespace)
+ on (namespace)
(sum(windows_container_memory_usage_commit_bytes{container_id!="", cluster="$cluster"} * on (container_id) group_left (container, pod, namespace) max by ( container, container_id, pod, namespace) (kube_pod_container_info{container_id!="", cluster="$cluster"}) OR kube_namespace_created{cluster="$cluster"} * 0) by (namespace))

panels.title: Memory Utilization by namespace

panels.description: Current cluster CPU usage (%) over time across all instances,  with a table displaying minimum, maximum, and average usage and a time-based graph for trends

targets.expr: avg(sum by (instance, cpu) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode!~"idle|iowait|steal", cluster="$cluster", job="$job"}[$__rate_interval]))) by (instance)

panels.title: All instances CPU Utilization

panels.description: Current cluster Memory usage (%) over time across all instances,  with a table displaying minimum, maximum, and average usage and a time-based graph for trends
panels.title: All Instances Memory Utilization

panels.description: measures the total time workloads in worker nodes were restricted from using CPU due to hitting their defined limits, indicating potential performance bottlenecks.
panels.title: CPU Throttled cores by Instances

panels.description:
**Burstable Pods** – Pods with set requests and higher limits, letting them use extra resources if available.
**BestEffort Pods** – Pods with no requests or limits, giving them the lowest priority and higher eviction risk.
**Guaranteed Pods** – Pods with equal requests and limits, ensuring they always receive their reserved resources.
panels.title: Kubernetes Pods QoS classes

panels.description:
**Evicted** – Shows how many pods were forcefully removed due to resource pressure or policy violations.
**NodeAffinity** – Tracks pods affected by scheduling constraints due to node affinity rules.
**NodeLost** – Indicates the number of pods impacted when a node becomes unresponsive.
**Shutdown** – Tracks pod was intentionally stopped caused by node shutdowns or planned maintenance.
**UnexpectedAdmissionError** – A pod failed to schedule due to an unforeseen admission issue.
panels.title: Kubernetes Pod Status & Termination Reasons

panels.description: Tracks the number of times pods in each namespace were killed due to exceeding their memory limits, indicating potential resource shortages or misconfigurations.
panels.title: OOM Events by namespace

panels.description: Tracks how many times containers have restarted in each namespace
panels.title: Container Restarts by namespace

list.description: Very least CPU cores using, due to insufficient metric date points, it is recommended use at least 1m.
list.name: resolution

title: Kubernetes / Views / Global
